ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.23.0
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.23.0
New Features: - Video: Added support for Hardware MJPEG decoding using the "Direct to Framebuffer" decoding strategy. - Vector Rendering: Added support for Vector Font rendering.
Bugfixes: - Video: Some arbitrary video frame dimensions were decoded wrong when using Hardware decoding.
Improvements: - Vector Rendering: Software vector rendering can be selected for GPU2D-enabled projects. - Increased default GPU2D memory pool size have better performance when zooming in on SVGs.

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.22.1
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.22.1
New Features:
Bugfixes: - Removed compiler specific code from HardwareMJPEGDecoder.cpp. - Fixed crash bug in HardwareMJPEGDecoder.cpp when using CubeIDE/GCC. - Fixed compiler redefinition errors when including arm_compat.h (relates to new version of CMSIS in STM32CubeMX). - Moved videoRGBBuffer to a namespace in TouchGFXGeneratedHAL.cpp, to avoid buffer clearing at runtime.
Improvements: - GPU2D command list and stencil buffer can now be placed in different memories.

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.22.0
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.22.0
New Features: - Video: Added support for Hardware MJPEG decoding for STM32U5.
Bugfixes: - Disabled the possibility to use Partial Framebuffer if LTDC interface is selected. - Hardware MJPEG decoding were not synchronized properly with Canvas Widget Rendering.
Improvements: - Modified GPU2D and DMA2D parameters/options names and descriptions to be unambiguous. - Read-only parameters descriptions now point to the section of STM32CubeMX where they can be modified.

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.21.0
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.21.0
New Features: - Vector Rendering: Added support for Software and Hardware (GPU2D) Vector Rendering.
Bugfixes: - GPU2D (NeoChrom) interrupt priority lowered. Applications using FreeRTOS with GPU2D would have issues because SysTick interrupt was lower than GPU2D. - Missing driver includes for BW, Grey2 and Grey4 pixelformats are added in TouchGFXConfiguration.cpp file when selected.
Improvements: - Data Reader Interface: Allow user to specify the base address and the size of external non memory mapped memory. - GPU2D (NeoChrom) Command List Size and Memory Pool Location can now be configured. - Video: Added support for ARGB8888 (32-bit) Video Buffer for Software Decoding. - TouchGFX Core now handles DCache maintenance on Cortex-M7.

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.20.0
Release information :
New Features:
- Rendering of Canvas widgets in TouchGFX is now supported by DMA2D (ChromART) through new painter functions for RGB565 and RGB888. - Users can now configure GPIOs through CubeMX to measure the performance of their applications based on TouchGFX Events such as "Render Time", "Frame rate", "VSYNC". Read the HAL Development scenario at http://support.touchgfx.com.
Bugfixes:
- GPU2D (NeoChrom) in TouchGFX is currently only supported by ThreadX RTOS. For devices that support GPU2D, users were allowed to select other operating systems than ThreadX which would lead to compilation errors.

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.19.1
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.19.1
New Features:
Bugfixes: - Video: Some abitrary video frame dimensions were decoded wrong when using Hardware decodeding. - The function MX_TouchGFX_PreOSInit(void) was not properly generated for all RTOS.
Improvements: - Video: Double buffer video controller starts decoding video frames sooner.

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.19.0
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.19.0
New Features: - Native ThreadX Middleware support for U5 devices. - GPU2D can now be enabled as a graphics accelerator for MCUs that support it (.e.g. STM32U599)
Bugfixes: - Generator now handles DCache correctly on Cortex-M7.
Improvements: - Virtual functions HAL::beginFrame() and HAL::endFrame() are now defined in TouchGFXHAL.cpp. - Video: DMA2D is utilized to copy YCbCr video data to RGB video buffer(s) for MCUs that support it (.e.g. STM32H750)

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.18.1
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.18.1
New Features:
Bugfixes: - Video: Concurrent video streams were not syncronized properly. - Video: Video files containing empty frames were not handled properly by both Software- and Hardware decoder. - Video: MDK-ARM compilation would fail on tgfx_jpeg_utils.c.
Improvements: - Video: Ability to mix video buffer and framebuffer pixelformats for Software decoder., e.g. RGB565 video buffer on RGB888 framebuffer. - Video: RGB buffer can be placed in external memory, previously defaulted to internal. - Video: Decoders no longer Busy-Wait while waiting to finish decoding a single frame.

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.18.0
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.18.0
New Features: - Support for XRGB8888 (32-bit) framebuffer color format - Replaced use of NoDMA class with generated class - Video: Added support for Software and Hardware MJPEG decoding
Bugfixes: - Prevention of DMA class to change context when loading L8 clut
Improvements: - 16bpp DMA class now recieves 24-bit color for more accurate color to DMA - Generated code headers now specifies which files are to be modified by user

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.17.0
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.17.0
New Features: - Support for dual-core MCUs (H747, H745) - Support for ThreadX (depends on X-CUBE-AZRTOS-H7 pack) - Relevant functions now use OSWrappers::taskYield() if RTOS is used - Support for ARGB8888 (32-bit) framebuffer color format - Support for FMC display interface
Improvements: - Renamed Framebuffer Pixel Formats to be more in line with TouchGFX LCD classes ("Black White" => "BW", "Grey" => "Gray") - Support for new Blit Operations (BLIT_OP_COPY_L8, BLIT_OP_COPY_16BIT, BLIT_OP_FILL_16BIT) which simplify generated DMA2D code (STM32DMA.cpp) - Applications that mix image color formats and frame buffer color formats (e.g. RGB888 images on RGB565) now have improved DMA2D support
Bugfixes: - Disabling OS on H7 no longer causes an error. - Disabling dcache on M7 would fail. A run-time check is now done before clear/flush/invalidate dcache. - Fixed issue where re-genereating code in CubeMX from a G0 AT would cause SerialDataReader to not work properly

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.16.1
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.16.1
Bugfixes: - The function to enter the TouchGFX main event loop was not called when choosing "custom" RTOS.

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.16.0
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.16.0
New Features: - When selecting L8 for LTDC pixel format TouchGFX Generator will create a CLUT and load it into the LTDC at touchgfx::TouchGFXHAL::initialize(). - Optimized touchgfx driver for DMA2D when configuring blit operations. - New state machine to handle DCache invalidation only when necessary.
Bugfixes: - TouchGFX Generator was previously available for projects with dual Core MCUs H747* and H745* despite not being supported yet. - Correctly generating function name for "touchgfxDisplayDriverTransmitBlock". - Added missing implementation of OSWrappers::signalRenderingDone() for CMSIS V1, CMSIS V2, and Custom. - DataReader defaults to 250 bytes before invoking a DMA transfer. - startFlashLineRead, uses DMA to force parallel work.

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.15.0
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.15.0 - This version is compatible with STM32CubeMX V6.0.0 and TouchGFX Designer V4.15.0
New Features: - Data Reader interface for retrieving data from a non-memory-mapped flash - Cortex-M33 support - Improved Partial Framebuffer strategy - touchgfx_taskEntry() now uses OSWrappers::isVSyncAvailable() in case of No-OS

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.14.0
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.14.0 - This version is compatible with STM32CubeMX V6.0.0 and TouchGFX Designer V4.14.0
New Features: - Project updater for STM32CubeIDE adds -femit-class-debug-always flag to compilation to allow for debugging UI components. - HAL::blockCopy(void* RESTRICT dest, const void* RESTRICT src, uint32_t numBytes) is now exposed through TouchGFXHAL interface. - OSWrapper CMSISv1 and CMSISv2 no longer require FreeRTOS middleware to be enabled; this allows usage of any CMSIS compatible RTOS. - Project updater now supports ARMCLANG.
Bugfixes: - Fixed missing extern functions for Partial Framebuffer Strategy. - Project updater now correctly updates STM32CubeIDE projects - Fixed potential lock up when using CMSISv2 driver.

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.13.0
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.13.0 - Generates partial TouchGFX application projects based on hardware configuration - Configure TouchGFX application with TouchGFX Designer - This version is compatible with STM32CubeMX V5.5.x and TouchGFX Designer V4.13.0

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-IPS
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: The X-CUBE-IPS expansion software package for STM32Cube runs on the STM32 and includes drivers that control the industrial intelligent power switches (IPS)

Note.Release: Release version : 3.1.0 Release date : 2024-12-17 Release information : Official CubeMX SW Pack release for X-CUBE-IPS package [20241217-030100-01-006] The X-CUBE-IPS software package expands the STM32Cube functionality adding the capability to build applications for high efficiency high-side and low-side switches: octal (high-side): ISO8200BQ, ISO8200AQ, IPS8160HQ, IPS8160HQ-1, ISO808, ISO808-1, ISO808A, ISO808A-1, IPS8200HQ and IPS8200HQ-1 quad (low-side): IPS4260L quad (high-side): IPS4140HQ, IPS4140HQ-1 dual (high-side): IPS2050H and IPS2050H-32 single (high-side): IPS160HF, IPS161HF, IPS1025H, IPS1025H-32 and IPS1025HF This software allows controlling the digital output of a single expansion board, or a properly configured stack of these expansion boards. It also allows you to program the expansion boards to be switched on and off using PWM with a specific frequency in the 0-100 Hz range (0.1 Hz resolution), and specific duty cycle in the 0-100% range (1% resolution). The package includes examples to test the device functionality while driving the channels in the steady state and PWM. Sample implementations are available on the following expansion boards, fully debugged on NUCLEO-F401RE and NUCLEO-G431RB development boards: X-NUCLEO-OUT01A2 X-NUCLEO-OUT02A1 X-NUCLEO-OUT03A1 X-NUCLEO-OUT04A1 X-NUCLEO-OUT05A1 X-NUCLEO-OUT06A1 X-NUCLEO-OUT07A1 X-NUCLEO-OUT08A1 X-NUCLEO-OUT09A1 X-NUCLEO-OUT10A1 X-NUCLEO-OUT11A1 X-NUCLEO-OUT12A1 X-NUCLEO-OUT13A1 X-NUCLEO-OUT14A1 X-NUCLEO-OUT15A1 X-NUCLEO-OUT16A1 X-NUCLEO-OUT17A1 X-NUCLEO-OUT19A1 X-NUCLEO-DO40A1 X-NUCLEO-DO41A1

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-DPower
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: This pack has been developped to start-up with various DSMPS topologies. It contains our Digital Power source code library and projects, as well as one jointly developped with our Biricha Digital Power Ltd. partner. All supporting the STM32 for numerous PFC and PSU topologies. The projects are implementing Poles Zeros controllers to present better system performances than usual PID based controllers, while making easier complete system tuning. However, when resonnant converters are used, PID controller is still used.

Note.Release: Release version : 1.2.0 Release date : 2024-06-30 Release information : This pack has been generated with STM32CubeMX v6.11.1 and STM32PackCreator 3.7.0 The supported topologies are the folowing: 1/ AC/DC converter : -> Interleaved Boost (CCM) -> Interleaved Totem Pole (CCM) 2/ DC/DC converter : -> Full-Bridge Phase-Shifted (CCM) -> Buck in Voltage and Current mode (CCM) -> Boost in Voltage mode (CCM) -> LLC in Resonant mode (TCM) Pack Restrictions : - Restricted to processor vendor: STMicroelectronics:13

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-DISPLAY
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: Expansion Pack for display modules

Note.Release:
Release version : 3.0.0 Release date : 2023-01-18
Release information : - This version is compatible with STM32CubeMX V6.7.0 New Features: - Added support for Cortex-M7 devices - Added LCD Utilities to support displaying transparent Texts - Added GFX01M2_Custom Application example for the NUCLEO-WB55RG board - Added GFX02Z1_Custom Application example for the NUCLEO-U575ZI board - Added GFX01M2_FlashLoader Application example for the NUCLEO-WB55RG board - Added GFX02Z1_FlashLoader Application example for the NUCLEO-L4R5ZI board - Added GFX02Z1_FlashLoader Application example for the NUCLEO-U575ZI board - Added GFX02Z1_HelloWorld Application example for the NUCLEO-H723ZG board - Added GFX02Z1_FlashLoader Application example for the NUCLEO-H723ZG board - Removed deprecated functions
Bugfixes: - Fixed issue with generated mem_io code when using DMA - Fixed issues with Custom LCD and external memory interfaces
Improvements: - Updated ILI9341 LCD Drivers - Updated ST7789V LCD Drivers - Updated MX25L6433F External Memory Drivers - Enhanced HelloWorld Examples - Allow displaying transparent text for the Boards information, the example’s Hints and the Copyrights - Implemented rendering/display queue to allow parallel rendering and display SPI transfers - Updated STM32WBxx_HAL_Drivers to v1.11.0 - Allow using DMA for external OctoSPI memories - Rework DMA support for new devices - Enable QSPI Bus Type for Custom Memory interface - oswrapper: remove extra include to HAL header files for NoOS template - mem_io: add flash page and block size defines
Pack Restrictions : - Restricted to processor vendor: STMicroelectronics:13

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-DISPLAY
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: Expansion Pack for display modules

Note.Release:
Release version : 2.2.0 Release date : 2022-05-02
Release information : - This version is compatible with STM32CubeMX V6.5.0 New Features: - Added Support for Custom LCD Controllers - Added Support for Custom External Memory Controllers - Generated PDF and CHM API Documentation
Bugfixes: - Fix Issue with undefined BRR for non supported series F7 and H7 - Disable the SW pack when TrustZone is enabled
Improvements: - Disable the SW pack for non-supported STM32 Families - STM32CubeIDE: add debug launcher files
Pack Restrictions : - Restricted to processor vendor: STMicroelectronics:13

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-DISPLAY
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: Expansion Pack for display modules

Note.Release:
Release version : 2.1.0 Release date : 2022-04-08
Release information : - This version is compatible with STM32CubeMX V6.5.0 New Features: - Support Real Time Operating systems: FreeRTOS and ThreadX Native Middleware - Support HW Timers for TE Event and line counting - Support disabling TE Events - Support Little and Big ENDIANS - Support swap of Red and Blue components
Bugfixes: - Deprecated API BSP_MEM_GetTransfertStatus() and renamed to BSP_MEM_GetTransferStatus() - Deprecated API BSP_MEM_SignalTransfertDone() and renamed to BSP_MEM_SignalTransferDone() - Deprecated API BSP_LCD_GetTransfertStatus() and renamed to BSP_LCD_GetTransferStatus() - Deprecated API BSP_LCD_SignalTransfertDone() and renamed to BSP_LCD_SignalTransferDone() - Fixed Dependencies for Board Part - Fixed destination folder to be always DISPLAY - Clean-up header file include for BSP Drivers - External Loaders : Fixed issue with STM32CubeIDE not able to load external loaders
Improvements: - Support Linked list GPDMA requests for FMC LCD Controllers - Release LCD/MEM locks before notifying upper levels - MEM: Exported size of external Flash memory - LCD: Set default Vsync Frequency to 60 Hz - Disable DMA parameter for OCTOSPI external memories - ExternalLoaders : Added MX25L6433F_GFX01M2_STM32L4.stldr
Pack Restrictions : - Restricted to processor vendor: STMicroelectronics:13

ThirdParty.ShortDescription: Artificial Intelligence

Note.Release: Release version : 9.0.0 Release information : Artificial Intelligence Pack version 9.0.0 for STM32 Cortex M7, M4, M0, and M33 MCUs improvements/enhancements: - improve inference time for quantized convolutional kernels - new operators: - Keras ConvTranspose - TFLite NOT_EQUAL, GELU, ZEROS_LIKE - ONNX Mod - introduce new embedded C-API (experimental) - usage of the CRC IP to lock the network-runtime library has been removed - based on a new CLI executable, stedgeai core, targetting different ST device - bug fixing

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-AI
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: Artificial Intelligence

Note.Release:
Release version : 8.1.0
Release information :
Artificial Intelligence Pack version 8.1.0 for STM32 Cortex M7, M4, M0 and M33 MCUs What's new in this release: - Support of Mac arm64 architecture - Performance improvements of the embedded inference library - TensorFlow 2.12 and Keras.io 2.12 - updated Tensorflow Lite for Micro (2023-05-03 snapshot) - ONNX Runtime 1.13.1

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-AI
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: Artificial Intelligence

Note.Release:
Release version : 8.0.1
Release information :
Artificial Intelligence Pack version 8.0.1 for STM32 Cortex M7, M4, M0 and M33 MCUs What's new in this release: - ONNX toolbox - add support for quantized ONNX models, Tensor-oriented (QDQ) file format - Input and Output of quantized ONNX models can stay in integer - add support to report the requested runtime memory size (analyze/generate commands) - implement MCUNetV2 RAM optimization techniques - H dimension - TensorFlow 2.11 and Keras.io 2.11 - updated Tensorflow Lite for Micro (2023-01-06 snapshot) - ONNX Runtime 1.13.1 - Align with CMSIS 5.9

ThirdParty.Name: FP-SNS-STBOX1
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: The FP-SNS-STBOX1 is STM32Cube function pack for the Pro Mode of wireless multi sensor development kits The purpose of this functional pack is to provide simple applications and examples that show how to build custom applications for STEVAL-MKSBOX1V1, STEVAL-MKBOXPRO and STEVAL-STWINBX1 boards.

Note.Release: Release version : 2.0.0 Release date : 2024-03-05 The following packs are required : - STMicroelectronics X-CUBE-MEMS1 10.0.0 - STMicroelectronics X-CUBE-BLEMGR 3.1.0 - STMicroelectronics X-CUBE-NFC4 3.0.0 - STMicroelectronics X-CUBE-NFC7 1.0.1 Release information : Initial Releases

ThirdParty.Name: FP-SNS-SMARTAG2
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: The FP-SNS-SMARTAG2 is an STM32Cube function pack. Thanks to this package you can read the ambient light, motion and environmental sensor data on your IoT node by the means of an NFC enabled reader, such as a mobile phone or tablet, throught a suitable AndroidST or iOST application such as the ST Asset Tracking and ST NFC Sensor

Note.Release:
Release version : 1.2.0 Release date : 2023-04-20
The following packs are required : - STMicroelectronics X-CUBE-MEMS1 9.6.0 - STMicroelectronics X-CUBE-NFC7 1.0.0 - STMicroelectronics X-CUBE-ALS 1.0.1
Release information : First official release of the FP-SNS-SMARTAG2 support package. Create sample applications with STM32CubeMX v.6.9.0 or higher

ThirdParty.Name: FP-SNS-MOTENV1
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: The FP-SNS-MOTENV1 is an STM32Cube function pack which lets you connect your IoT node to a smartphone via BLE and use a suitable AndroidT or iOST like the ST BLE Sensor app to view real-time environmental sensor data and motion sensor data. The package also enables advanced functionality such as sensor data fusion and accelerometer-based real-time activity recognition, carry position, gesture recognition, pedometer, motion Intensity and compass. This package, together with the suggested combination of STM32 and ST devices can be used to develop specific wearable applications, or smart things applications in general. The software runs on the STM32 microcontroller and includes all the necessary drivers to recognize the devices on the STM32 Nucleo development board and expansion boards.

Note.Release: Release version : 5.0.0 Release date : 2023-12-18 The following packs are required : - STMicroelectronics X-CUBE-MEMS1 10.0.0 - STMicroelectronics X-CUBE-BLEMGR 3.0.0 - STMicroelectronics X-CUBE-BLE2 3.3.0 Release information : Official release of the FP_SNS-MOTENV1 support package. Create sample applications with STM32CubeMX v.6.10.0 or higher

ThirdParty.Name: AIROC-Wi-Fi-Bluetooth-STM32
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: The Infineon AIROC-Wi-Fi-Bluetooth-STM32 Expansion Pack is an extension of the CMSIS-Pack standard established by Arm. The pack is compliant with the full CMSIS-Pack standard, with additional requirements/restrictions on the final pack to meet the STM standard. You can select and configure the pack in the STM32CubeMX tool, make choices appropriate for your design, such as which CYW43xxx device to use, and then generate a project from your selection.

Note.Release:
Release version : 1.5.1 Release date : 2023-09-01
Release information :
Patch Release (maintenance Bluetooth FW)
What's New? * Update Bluetooth FW for Murata 2BC/2AE modules * Update Bluetooth FW for Laird STERLING-LWB5plus module * Update PDSC
What's Included? * Supported Connectivity Modules - CYW43012 - CYW4343W / CYW43438 - CYW4373 - CYW55500 - CYW55572 - CYW43022
* Expansion Pack Contents - btstack v.3.7.1 - btstack-integration v.4.3.1 - wifi-host-driver v.3.1.0 - wcm v.3.1.1 - whd-bsp-integration v.2.3.0 - lwip-freertos-integration v.1.0.0 - lwip-network-interface-integration v.1.0.0 - netxduo-network-interface-integration v.1.0.0 - connectivity-utilities v.4.1.1 - core-lib v.1.3.1 - abstraction-rtos v.1.5.0 - LwIP v.2.1.2 - PAL v.1.4.0 - Device v.1.2.0 - command-console v.4.0.0 - wifi-mfg-test v.3.3.0 - secure-sockets v.3.0.0 - stm32_mw_freertos v.10.4.6 - wpa3_external_supplicant v.1.1.0
* Examples - Wi-Fi Scan Example - Wi-Fi Onboarding with BLE - Azure RTOS NetXDuo Wi-Fi UDP echo server - Wi-Fi BT Tester - Wi-Fi Manufacturing Tester - Bluetooth Manufacturing Tester - BLE Hello Sensor
